pullRequest.title: Update Reactor and Netty Dependencies
pullRequest.bodyText: This PR updates our Reactor dependency from 3.3.x to 3.4.x, Reactor Netty from 0.9.x to 1.0.x, and upgrades Spring usage to 2.4.x. The Reactor and Reactor Netty version upgrades contain backwards compatibility breaking changes for the libraries.

nodes.bodyText:
@kasobol-msft, @rickle-msft, @gapra-msft, I updated this to use boundedElastic over elastic as elastic has been deprecated and allows for an unbounded number of threads to be created.
Additionally, I changed this from subscribeOn to publishOn as subscribeOn affects the entire reactive chain, including all reactive operations applied before this point in time. publishOn only affects the reactive chain after the publishOn operator. So, with this chain operators before this point should use either the default or what a customer has configured, after this point it will use the thread-pool based boundedElastic scheduler to handle blocking I/O with potentially many threads.

I see reactor-netty 1.0.1 depends on netty 4.1.53.Final releases, any reason why we are updating them to 4.1.54.Final ?
https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.projectreactor.netty/reactor-netty-core/1.0.1

beforeCommit.message: Update Spring versions in attempt to fix failing Spring tests

commit.message: Fix checkstyle issue and upped test timeouts

nodes.bodyText: This change is required as retry(int, Predicate<Throwable>) was removed in Reactor 3.4.0
Revert all changes like this as subscriberContext was only deprecated.

commit.message: Update Spring versions and remove test logic to change Spring version
Downgrade Mockito as it is causing test failures
Fix deserializer looking for a property no longer being generated, redirectUriTemplate -> redirectUri
Remove Spring Framework version changing in Cosmos

nodes.bodyText:
Hi, @alzimmermsft ,
I think you do not need to update it.
Because after spring-boot's version upgrade to 2.4.0, the spring-security will update to 5.4.1, I'll use ClientRegistrationDeserializer.java in spring-security, and delete all contents in package com.azure.spring.aad.webapp.jackson
cc @yiliuTo , FYI
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,7 +53,7 @@ public ClientRegistration deserialize(JsonParser parser, DeserializationContext
             .authorizationGrantType(
                 AUTHORIZATION_GRANT_TYPE_CONVERTER.convert(
                     findObjectNode(clientRegistrationNode, "authorizationGrantType")))
-            .redirectUriTemplate(findStringValue(clientRegistrationNode, "redirectUriTemplate"))
+            .redirectUri(findStringValue(clientRegistrationNode, "redirectUri"))

nodes.bodyText: Why do we have both subscribeOn and publishOn? The last publishOn always wins over the subscribeOn.
Why do we need unreleased azure-core dependency for app config?
Why did we have this step before?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,15 +15,3 @@ jobs:
         AZURE_CLIENT_ID: $(aad-azure-sdk-test-client-id)
         AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET: $(aad-azure-sdk-test-client-secret)
         AZURE_TENANT_ID: $(aad-azure-sdk-test-tenant-id)
-      PostRunSteps:
-        - script: |
-            python --version
-            python -m pip install setuptools termcolor in_place
-            python sdk/spring/scripts/replace_util.py --module appconfiguration --log debug --color false
-          displayName: 'Run replace_util.py'
-        - task: Maven@3
-          displayName: 'Run tests again.'

nodes.bodyText: Same here - don't need both subscribeOn and publishOn. Just publishOn is sufficient.
Can this be removed or narrowed down to export to specific modules only? exports ... to ...
Shouldn't this be transitively available through com.azure.core?
What deprecated method is being used here?
These libraries still use 3.3.x of Reactor

commit.message: Merge in upstream, updates based on PR review
Resolve test failures caused by changes to Mockito default value changes
Update jacoco setting to make build pass.
Enable JUnit 4 and JUnit 5 tests to run side-by-side in azure-spring-boot
Try to fix the failure in ConsistencyReaderTest by increase TIMEOUT value.
Try to fix test failure in ConsistencyReaderTest by update version of reactor-netty and reactor-core.
In replace_util.py, update spring-boot-starter-parent's version to 2.4.0.
In external_dependencies.txt, update spring-boot-starter-parent's version to 2.4.1.
Change logger name to class name to help differentiate deadlock
